item.title: Subset Daily Time Series Data Using Data.Table Package
item.description: Source:‘ectolus.com’ This blog post shows how to get the beginning (end) of the month (year) observations from daily time series data. In my dissertation, I needed to calculate monthly returns and get the book-value and the market-value of the last day of June and December for different firms to construct Fama-French three-factor model. The easiest way I found to achieve this is through the code shown in this post.

item.title: The two most important functions for data visualisation in R

item.title: Inner Join, Outter Join, Left Join, Right Join, Row Bind and Column Bind in R
item.description: The merge operations is well explained in Pandas documentation for Python but I could not find any documentation that is as good for R. Hence, I am writing this blog :) Let’s say we have these two data frames #import libraries library('data.table') df1<-data.frame(Country=c('US','UK',"New Zealand"),Rank =c(1,2,3)) df2<-data.frame(Country=c('US','UK',"New Zealand"),Population =c(300,80,4)) df1 ## Country Rank ## 1 US 1 ## 2 UK 2 ## 3 New Zealand 3 df2 ## Country Population ## 1 US 300 ## 2 UK 80 ## 3 New Zealand 4 Before jumping to merging these two data frames, we can consider adding one data frame to another.
